fee_codes.description: Oesophagoscopy, with or without biopsy(ies)
oesophagoscopy-gastroscopy, elective
oesophagoscopy-gastroscopy, for active bleeding
oesophagoscopy with dilatation of oesophagus
oesophagoscopy with multiple (3 or more) biopsies of specific lesion
oesophagoscopy with removal of foreign body(ies)
oesophagoscopy with brushing of oesophagus, stomach, and/or duodenum
oesophagoscopy with duodenoscopy and drainage of bile after I.V. CCK stimulation
oesophagoscopy with laser debulking
oesophagoscopy with pneumatic or balloon dilation
oesophagoscopy with snare polypectomy first polyp (> 1 cm)
oesophagoscopy each additional polyp, by snare polypectomy (> 1 cm) (to a maximum of 2)
management of uncomplicated upper or lower gastrointestinal bleeding, by any technique (e.g. laser, injection, diathermy, banding etc.)
management of complicated upper gastrointestinal bleeding by any technique in haemodynamically unstable patients with active bleeding during endoscopy
endoscopic placement of stent in duodenum
Oesophagostomy, cervical approach, other than neonatal
Oesophagostomy, cervical approach, neonatal
Intrathoracic oesophageal stent via laparotomy
Intrathoracic oesophageal stent via oesophagoscope (includes Z515)
Trans-oesophageal division of oesophageal varices
Oesophageal-gastric devascularization (including splenectomy and oesophageal division/anastomosis)
Intrathoracic diverticulum
Cricopharyngeal myotomy, open approach
Cricopharyngeal myotomy, when rendered by endoscopy, or in association with a surgical procedure during the same anaesthetic
Cricopharyngeal diverticulum
Partial oesophageal resection and reconstruction (including intestinal transposition)
Total thoracic oesophageal resection
oesophageal resection with reconstruction
oesophageal resection with reconstruction of diaphragm requiring repair with mesh or equivalent synthetic material
radical mediastinal node dissection following preoperative chemotherapy and/or radiotherapy, to S089 or S090
Enucleation of benign oesophageal tumour
Oesophageal myotomy, partial (below aortic arch)
Total thoracic oesophageal myotomy (as sole procedure)
Oesophageal hiatus hernia, abdominal or transthoracic approach with fundal plication
Oesophageal hiatus hernia, recurrent
massive paraesophageal hernia
Oesophageal stricture (Thal) - may include oesophageal hiatus hernia repair with or without gastroplasty
Ruptured oesophagus, suture and drainage
Oesophago-gastrostomy for bypass (as sole procedure)
Closure of H-type tracheo-oesophageal fistula by cervical or thoracic approach
Repair of oesophageal atresia with or without tracheal fistula
Dilation of oesophagus, initial session
Dilation of oesophagus, repeat session (within three months following previous dilation)
Pneumatic dilation of oesophagus as sole procedure
Pneumatic dilation of oesophagus with rigid dilators guided over a string or wire
Repeat dilations during the same admission
